manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The last dragons were killed a half century ago. At least that's what 12-year-old Eliana has always heard... Editorial Reviews "In this series opener, Evans parcels out the drama among her cast in perfect measure…Gorgeous prose highlights some sinister aspects of the tale, as when the “long, pale hand” of Margred “emerged with a sigh from her silken midnight blue robes and swept like a white moth in an arc.”... As the narrative’s mystery wraps up, the characters are on excellent footing to face greater dangers in subsequent volumes…A charming, smartly crafted fantasy world that readers will want to linger in." — Kirkus Reviews

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love that the girl was able to communicate with the dragon and help recuse dragon's family and the kingdom from dangers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I read previews of this book. I bought for my granddaughter for Christmas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful and Captivating!
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book! The author has such a vivid imagination and attention to detail. I believe I understand so much about kind dragons! The characters are so beautifully developed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My daughter read this in a day. She said she couldn't put it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super interesting story
reviews.reviewText: I read this aloud to my 8 year old daughter (and some of it to my 6 year old boy). It was a super fun story, very engaging. Not too dark, but enough drama to keep us reading. We are looking forward to the next book (we're hoping). The disappointment that a second book didn't exist yet was palpable on my daughter. You are amazing, keep going!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Bought as gift .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A delightful and compelling story of friendship, adventure, and fantasy
reviews.reviewText: I read this book aloud to my 8-year-old son and my 10-year-old daughter. We were all enraptured and stayed up FAR too late night after night sneaking in another chapter. The writing is beautifully crafted with tons of imagery and sensory details that helped us to imagine Eliana's world. We loved tracking the breadcrumbs of clues that Findley Evans left and trying to infer and predict which would be important and what would happen next. The characters were brave and big-hearted risk takers-- the kinds I hope my own children grow up to be.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can't wait for the sequel!
reviews.reviewText: As a former fifth grade teacher, one of my primary goals was to encourage a love for reading in my students. I read countless books for middle school aged children and stocked my classroom library with the best I could find. The Dragon and the Girl: True North would have been one of my choices for a read aloud or for literature circles. I loved it! Not only was the story compelling, but the writing was stellar! Laura Findley Evans has created well-drawn characters that you care about from the beginning, as well as a villain who oozes evil. I cannot wait for more adventures with Eliana and Winston!
